chapter.title: System Admin Maintenance Documents
chapter.para: System Admin maintenance e-docs are available via the System Admin submenu on the Maintenance menu.

section.title:
Campus CampusMaintenanceDocument
Locations submenu group CampusMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> Locations
> Campus
> Campus Lookup
> Campus Maintenance Document

section.para: The CampusMaintenanceDocument is used to identify the different fiscal and physical operating entities of an institution for use in OLE. A campus may be identified as a fiscal entity, a physical entity, or both.

When the user chooses the Campus option, the system displays the Campus Lookup screen. After the user selects a campus or clicks the create new button, the system presents the CampusMaintenanceDocument.

section.title: Edit Campus Tab
section.para: The CampusMaintenanceDocument includes the Edit Campus tab CampusMaintenanceDocument Edit Campus tab .
In edit mode, the Edit Campus tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

entry.para: Required. The unique identifying code assigned to a campus.
Required. The familiar name for a specific university campus.
Required. An abbreviated name for a specific campus; used in reports in which space is limited.
Required. Indicates the type of campus. Valid values are:

section.title:
Country CountryMaintenanceDocument
Locations submenu group CountryMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> Country
> Country Lookup
> Country Maintenance Document

section.para: The Country Maintenance document is used to assign specific identifying codes to country names.

When the user chooses the Country option from the menu, the system displays the Country Lookup screen. After the user selects a country or clicks the create new button, the system presents the Country Maintenance document.

section.title: Edit Country Tab
section.para: The Country Maintenance document includes the Edit Country tab CountryMaintenanceDocument Edit Country tab .
In edit mode, the Edit Country tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

para.phrase: Required. A unique identifying code assigned to a country.
Required. A familiar name of a specific country.

entry.para: An alternative code assigned to a country.
Indicates whether this country code is active or inactive in OLE. Remove the check mark to deactivate this country code.

section.title:
County CountyMaintenanceDocument
Locations submenu group CountyMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> County
> County Code Lookup
> County Maintenance Document

section.para: The County Maintenance document is used to assign specific identifying codes to county names.

When the user chooses the County option from the Admin menu tab, the system displays the County Lookup screen. After the user selects a county or clicks the create new button, the system presents the County Maintenance document.

section.title: Edit Counties Tab
section.para: The County Maintenance document includes the Edit Counties tab CountyMaintenanceDocument Edit Counties tab .
In edit mode, the Edit Counties tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

para.phrase: The country code for the country in which this county is located.

entry.para: A unique identifying code assigned to this county.
The state abbreviation assigned to the state in which a county is located.
Required. The familiar name of this county.
Indicates whether the county code is active or inactive in OLE. Remove the check mark to deactivate this county code.

section.title:
Postal Code PostalCodeMaintenanceDocument
Locations submenu group PostalCodeMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> Postal Code
> Postal Code Lookup
> Postal Code Maintenance Document

section.para: The Postal Code Maintenance document defines the zip code by city and state. When the user chooses the Postal Code option from the Admin menu tab, the system displays the Postal Code Lookup screen. After the user selects a postal code or clicks the create new button, the system presents the Postal Code Maintenance document.

note.para: The user may also enter a city and state to find the associated zip code.

section.title: Edit Postal Codes Tab
section.para: The Postal Code Maintenance document includes the Edit Postal Codes tab PostalCodeMaintenanceDocument Edit Postal Codes tab .
In edit mode, the Edit Postal Codes tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

para.phrase: The country code for the country associated with the zip (postal) code.

entry.para: Required. The state associated with the zip (postal) code.
The unique identifying code for the county associated with the zip (postal) code.
Required. The name of the city associated with the zip (postal) code.
Indicates whether the postal code is active or inactive in OLE. Remove the check mark to deactivate this postal code.

section.title:
State StateMaintenanceDocument
Locations submenu group StateMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> State
> State Code Lookup
> State Maintenance Document

section.para: The State Maintenance document defines the U.S. Postal Service codes used to identify states. When the user chooses the State option from the Admin menu tab, the system displays the State Code Lookup screen. After the user selects a state code or clicks the create new button, the system presents the State Maintenance document.

section.title: Edit States Tab
section.para: The State Maintenance document includes the Edit States tab StateMaintenanceDocument Edit States tab .
In edit mode, the Edit States tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

entry.para: A unique identifying code assigned to the country of which this state is a part.
Required. The full name of the state associated with the state abbreviation.
Indicates whether the state code is active or inactive in OLE. Remove the check mark to deactivate the state code.

section.title:
Address Type Address Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Address Type Lookup

para.emphasis:
> Reference
> Address Type
> Address Type Lookup

section.para: The Address Type Lookup displays the types of addresses that may be associated with Person records in KIM.

note.para: Address types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing address types.

mediaobject.alt: Address Type Lookup with Search Results Displayed

entry.para: Display only. The unique code for this type of address.
Display only. The familiar title of this address type.
Display only. An alphabetical character used to determine the order in which address types are displayed in the list on the Person document.
Display only. Indicates whether this address type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Address Type list on the Person document).

section.title:
Affiliation Type Affiliation Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Affiliation Type Lookup
section.para: Affiliation types specify codes and text descriptions for the different types of affiliations that can be associated with a Person record in KIM. These codes may be used for data sorting or retrieval purposes. The Affiliation Type Lookup displays the valid affiliation code types.

note.para: Affiliation types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing affiliation types.

mediaobject.alt: Affiliation Type Lookup Screen with Search Results Displayed

entry.para: Display only. A unique code that identifies this type of affiliation. The base values are:
AFLT = Affiliate, FCLTY = Faculty, STAFF = Staff, STDNT = Student
Display only. A text description of this type of affiliation.
Display only. An alphabetical character used to determine the order in which the system displays affiliation types in the list.
Display only. Indicates whether this type of affiliation is active (in which case the system displays it in the Affiliation Typelist on the Person document).

section.title:
Campus Type Campus Type Lookup
CampusTypeMaintenanceDocument
Reference submenu group Campus Type Lookup
Reference submenu group CampusTypeMaintenanceDocument

para.emphasis:
> Campus Type
> Campus Type Lookup
> Campus Type Maintenance Document

section.para: When the user selects Campus Type from the Admin menu tab, the system displays the Campus Type Lookup. From this screen, the user may either create a new type or search for an existing type. This defines the valid types of campuses that can be selected when creating a new campus.
After performing a search based on user-specified criteria, the system displays a results table. The user may then choose to edit or copy a retrieved record.
After the user selects create new, edit, or copy, the system displays the Campus Type Maintenance document. This document allows users to add and maintain campus types.

note.para: While anyone can view the current values for campus type, only members of OLE-SYS Manager or KR-SYS Technical Manager roles can create new campus types or edit existing values. This document does not route for approval.

section.title: Edit Campus Type Tab
section.para: The Campus Type Maintenance document includes the Edit Campus Type tab PostalCodeMaintenanceDocument Edit Postal Codes tab .
In edit mode, the Edit Campus Type tab presents a display-only set of fields on the left and editable fields on the right in which the user may enter changes.

entry.para: Required. Enter a code to identify this type of campus.
Required. Enter a descriptive name for this campus type.

section.title: Citizenship Status
section.para: The Citizenship Status Lookup is used to display the types of statuses that may be entered on a Person record in KIM.

note.para: Citizenship Status cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing status types.

entry.para: The code used to identify citizen status.
The familiar name of the citizen status.
Display only. Indicates whether this citizen status type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Citizen Status list on the Person document).

section.title:
Email Type Email Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Email Type Lookup
section.para: The Email Type Lookup is used to display the types of email addresses that may be entered on a Person record in KIM.

note.para: Email types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing email types.

mediaobject.alt: Email Type Lookup with Search Results Displayed

para.emphasis: Email Type Code Lookup results definition

entry.para: Display only. A unique code identifying this type of email address. The base data values are:
HM = Home, OTH = Other, WRK = Work
Display only. A descriptive label for this type of email address.
Display only. An alphabetical character used to determine the order in which email address types are displayed in the list on the Person record.
Display only. Indicates whether this email address type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Email Type list on the Person document).

section.title:
Employee Type Employee Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Employee Type Lookup
section.para: The Employee Type Lookup allows you to view the various status codes that can be assigned to a faculty or staff type of affiliation on the Person document in KIM.

note.para: Employee types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing employee types.

mediaobject.alt: Employee Type Lookup with Search Results Displayed

entry.para: Display only. A unique code identifying this type of employee. The base data values are:
N = Non-Professional, O = Other, P = Professional
Display only. A descriptive label for this type of employee.
Display only. A numeric value used to determine the order in which employee types are displayed in the list.
Display only. Indicates whether this employee type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Employee Type list on the Person document).

section.title:
Entity Type Entity Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Entity Type Lookup
section.para: The Entity Type Lookup displays the various entity types recognized in KIM.

note.para: Entity types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing entity types.

mediaobject.alt: Entity Type Lookup With Search Results Displayed

entry.para: Display only. A unique code that identifies this entity type. The base data values are:
Display only. A descriptive label for this entity type.
Display only. A numeric value used to determine the order in which entity types would be displayed in a list.
Display only. Indicates whether this entity type is active. Because entity types are not viewable elsewhere in the application, inactivation will have no apparent effect.

section.title:
External Identifier Type External Identifier Type Lookup
Reference submenu group External Identifier Type Lookup

para.emphasis:
> External Identifier Type
> External Identifier Type Lookup

section.para: The External Identifier Type Lookup displays the identifiers that may be associated with a Person record that has been generated by a non-Kuali system. The only example in OLE base data is Tax ID number.

note.para: External identifier types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing external identifier types.

mediaobject.alt: External Identifier Type Lookup with Search Results Displayed

entry.para: Display only. A unique code that identifies this external identifier type. The base data value is:
Display only. A descriptive label for this external identifier type.
Display only. A numeric value that determines the order in which external identifier types are displayed in the list.
Display only. Indicates whether this external identifier type is active.

section.title:
Name Type Entity Name Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Entity Name Type Lookup

para.emphasis:
> Name Type
> Entity Name Type Lookup

section.para: The Entity Name Type Lookup allows you to view the types of names that can be associated with a person on the Contact tab of a KIM Person document.

note.para: Name types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing name types.

mediaobject.alt: Entity Name Type Lookup With Search Results Displayed

para.emphasis: Entity Name Type Lookup results definition

entry.para: Display only. A unique code that identifies this type of name. The base data values are:
OTH = Other, PRFR = Preferred, PRM = Primary
Display only. A descriptive label for this name type.
Display only. An alphabetic value that determines the order in which name types are displayed in the list.
Display only. Indicates whether this name type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Name Typelist on the Person document).

section.title:
Phone Type Phone Type Lookup
Reference submenu group Phone Type Lookup
section.para: The Phone Type Lookup displays codes that identify various categories of phone numbers on the Person document.

note.para: Phone types cannot be edited via the interface. Technical assistance is required to add new or edit existing phone types.

section.title: Document Layout

mediaobject.alt: Phone Type Lookup With Search Results Displayed

section.para: Phone Type Lookup results definition

entry.para: Display only. The code that identifies the type of phone number.
Display only. The descriptive name for this type of phone number.
Display only. An alphabetic value that determines the order in which phone types are displayed in the list.
Display only. Indicates whether this phone type is active (in which case the system displays it in the Phone Type list on the Person document).
